title: 114_s558
content: The Act may be cited as the "Presidential Library Donation Reform Act of 2015". It pertains to presidential libraries. The "Presidential Library Donation Reform Act of 2015" amends Section 2112 of title 44, United States Code, by adding a requirement for reporting contributions to Presidential library fundraising organizations. Contributions of $200 or more in a single calendar quarter must be reported. The Presidential Library Donation Reform Act of 2015 mandates reporting contributions of $200 or more to Presidential library fundraising organizations. Quarterly reports must include the amount and details of each contribution. The Presidential Library Donation Reform Act of 2015 requires reporting contributions of $200 or more to Presidential library fundraising organizations, including the amount, source, occupation (if individual), and date of the contribution. The reporting requirement lasts until the Archivist accepts, takes title to, or enters into an agreement for the Presidential archival depository. The Presidential Library Donation Reform Act of 2015 mandates reporting contributions of $200 or more to Presidential library fundraising organizations, including amount, source, occupation (if individual), and date of contribution. The Archivist must publish this information on the National Archives website within 30 days of submission, in a searchable format. The Presidential Library Donation Reform Act of 2015 requires reporting contributions of $200 or more to fundraising organizations, with details like amount, source, occupation (if individual), and date. It is prohibited to submit false information, with penalties outlined for individuals and organizations. The Presidential Library Donation Reform Act of 2015 mandates reporting contributions over $200 to fundraising organizations, prohibiting false information submission with penalties under section 1001 of title 18. It is also illegal to make contributions in another person's name. The Presidential Library Donation Reform Act of 2015 prohibits using another person's name for contributions and imposes penalties under the Federal Election Campaign Act. The Archivist will establish regulations for enforcement. The Presidential Library Donation Reform Act of 2015 defines "contribution" and "Presidential library fundraising organization" and applies to organizations established before or after the Act's enactment date, regarding contributions made after the enactment date.
